title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement jamesmcmahon0@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to octopusR
text: outlines propose change octopusR.

title: Contributing to octopusR
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to octopusR
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to octopusR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("Moohan/octopusR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to octopusR
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

code: @Manual{,   title = {octopusR: Interact with the 'Octopus Energy' API},   author = {James Hayes},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 1.0.1.9000},   url = {https://github.com/Moohan/octopusR}, }

what: Interact with the Octopus Energy API
title: Interact with the Octopus Energy API
text: octopusR R package provides access Octopus Energy REST API. octopusR, can easily retrieve data Octopus Energy API use R projects, Shiny dashboards. find package useful, sponsor GitHub sign Octopus Energy account referral code (jolly-bloom-201)!

title: Interact with the Octopus Energy API
text: octopusR can installed CRAN. like development version, can installed GitHub, using remotes package:
code: install.packages("octopusR") # Install remotes if needed if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("moohan/octopusR")

title: Interact with the Octopus Energy API
text: use functions octopusR, need API key Octopus Energy, can find developer dashboard. API key, can use set_api_key() interactively input store API key session: authenticated API, may also want set electric /gas meter details.
code: library(octopusR)  # Set your API key set_api_key() # Set details for your electricity meter set_meter_details(meter_type = "electricity")  # Set details for your gas meter set_meter_details(meter_type = "gas")  # For users with solar panels or export generation: # Set separate import and export electricity meters set_meter_details(meter_type = "electricity", direction = "import") set_meter_details(meter_type = "electricity", direction = "export")

title: Interact with the Octopus Energy API
text: octopusR supports distinguishing import export meters users solar panels generation sources: combine_consumption() function provides columns : - import_consumption: Energy imported grid - export_consumption: Energy exported grid - net_consumption: Net energy consumption (import - export) can use functions package interact API. example, can use get_consumption() function retrieve data energy usage: information examples, see package documentation Octopus Energy API documentation.
code: # Get import consumption (energy from grid) import_data <- get_consumption(meter_type = "electricity", direction = "import")  # Get export consumption (energy to grid)  export_data <- get_consumption(meter_type = "electricity", direction = "export")  # Combine import and export data with net consumption combined_data <- combine_consumption(   period_from = "2023-01-01",   period_to = "2023-01-31" ) # Get data about your energy usage energy_usage <- get_consumption(meter_type = "elec") #> ℹ Returning 100 rows only as a date range wasn't provided. #> ✔ Specify a date range with `period_to` and `period_from`.  # View the data head(energy_usage) #> # A tibble: 0 × 0

title: Interact with the Octopus Energy API
text: suggestions improving octopusR, found bug, please open issue. Contributions form pull requests also welcome. See guide contributing details.

title: Check a datetime argument is in a suitable format — check_datetime_format
text: Check given argument proper ISO 8601 format e.g. 2023-03-02T21:26:10Z. give informative error message.

what: Combine import and export consumption data — combine_consumption
title: Combine import and export consumption data — combine_consumption
text: Combine consumption data import export meters single tibble separate columns import export consumption. useful users solar panels export generation.

title: Combine import and export consumption data — combine_consumption
code: combine_consumption(   import_mpan = NULL,   import_serial = NULL,   export_mpan = NULL,   export_serial = NULL,   api_key = get_api_key(),   period_from = NULL,   period_to = NULL,   tz = NULL,   order_by = c("-period", "period"),   group_by = c("hour", "day", "week", "month", "quarter") )

title: Combine import and export consumption data — combine_consumption
text: import_mpan import meter MPAN import_serial import meter serial number export_mpan export meter MPAN export_serial export meter serial number api_key API key authentication period_from Show consumption given datetime (inclusive) period_to Show consumption given datetime (exclusive) tz Time zone date parsing (requires lubridate) order_by Ordering results returned group_by Aggregates consumption specified time period

title: Combine import and export consumption data — combine_consumption
text: tibble import_consumption, export_consumption, net_consumption columns

what: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
text: Return list consumption values half-hour periods given meter-point meter. Unit measurement: Electricity meters: kWh SMETS1 Secure gas meters: kWh SMETS2 gas meters: m^3

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
text: return dates properly parsed lubridate required. Use tz parameter specify time zone e.g. tz = "UTC", default (tz = NULL) return dates unparsed, characters.

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
code: get_consumption(   meter_type = c("electricity", "gas"),   mpan_mprn = NULL,   serial_number = NULL,   direction = NULL,   api_key = get_api_key(),   period_from = NULL,   period_to = NULL,   tz = NULL,   order_by = c("-period", "period"),   page_size = NULL,   group_by = c("hour", "day", "week", "month", "quarter") )

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
text: meter_type Type meter-point, electricity gas mpan_mprn electricity meter-point's MPAN gas meter-point’s MPRN. serial_number meter's serial number. direction electricity meters, specify "import", "export", NULL (default). NULL, uses legacy single MPAN storage. api_key API key. Octopus Energy customer, can generate API key developer dashboard. period_from Show consumption given datetime (inclusive). parameter can provided . period_to Show consumption given datetime (exclusive). parameter also requires providing period_from parameter create range. tz character string specifies time zone parse date . string must time zone recognized user's OS. order_by Ordering results returned. Default results returned reverse order latest available figure. Valid values: period, give results ordered forward. -period, (default), give results ordered recent backwards. page_size number results return per page. intended internal testing may removed future release. group_by Aggregates consumption specified time period. day considered start end midnight server's time zone. default consumption returned half-hour periods. Accepted values : hour day week month quarter

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
text: tibble requested consumption data.

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
text: fastest data aggregation, recommended either {data.table} {vctrs} packages installed.

what: Return a list of energy products — get_products
title: Return a list of energy products — get_products
text: default, results public energy products authenticated organisations also see products available organisation.

title: Return a list of energy products — get_products
code: get_products(   is_variable = NULL,   is_green = NULL,   is_tracker = NULL,   is_prepay = NULL,   is_business = FALSE,   available_at = Sys.Date(),   authenticate = FALSE,   api_key = NULL )

title: Return a list of energy products — get_products
text: is_variable (boolean, optional) Show variable products. is_green (boolean, optional) Show green products. is_tracker (boolean, optional) Show tracker products. is_prepay (boolean, optional) Show pre-pay products. is_business (boolean, default: FALSE) Show business products. available_at Show products available new agreements given datetime. Defaults current datetime, effectively showing products currently available. authenticate (boolean, default: FALSE) Use api_key authenticate. useful organisations. api_key API key. Octopus Energy customer, can generate API key developer dashboard.

title: Return a list of energy products — get_products
text: tibble

title: Return a list of energy products — get_products
code: get_products(is_green = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 10 × 16 #>    code        direction full_name display_name description is_variable is_green #>    <chr>       <chr>     <chr>     <chr>        <chr>       <lgl>       <lgl>    #>  1 AGILE-24-1… IMPORT    Agile Oc… Agile Octop… With Agile… TRUE        TRUE     #>  2 AGILE-OUTG… EXPORT    Agile Ou… Agile Outgo… Outgoing O… TRUE        TRUE     #>  3 COOP-SEG-E… EXPORT    Co-op Sm… Co-op Smart… This is ou… FALSE       TRUE     #>  4 COOP-SEG-F… EXPORT    Co-op Sm… Co-op Smart… This is ou… FALSE       TRUE     #>  5 CP-12M-26-… IMPORT    Co-op Co… Co-op Commu… This fixed… FALSE       TRUE     #>  6 LP-SEG-EO-… EXPORT    my londo… my london s… This is ou… FALSE       TRUE     #>  7 LP-SEG-FIX… EXPORT    my londo… my london s… This is ou… FALSE       TRUE     #>  8 OUTGOING-S… EXPORT    Octopus … Octopus Out… Outgoing S… FALSE       TRUE     #>  9 OUTGOING-S… EXPORT    Octopus … Octopus Out… Outgoing S… FALSE       TRUE     #> 10 OUTGOING-V… EXPORT    Outgoing… Outgoing Oc… Outgoing O… TRUE        TRUE     #> # ℹ 9 more variables: is_tracker <lgl>, is_prepay <lgl>, is_business <lgl>, #> #   is_restricted <lgl>, term <int>, available_from <chr>, available_to <chr>, #> #   links <list>, brand <chr>

what: Set the Octopus API key — set_api_key
title: Set the Octopus API key — set_api_key
text: Set Octopus API key use. stored environment variable. add OCTOPUSR_API_KEY = <api_key> .Renviron otherwise call function every session.

title: Set the Octopus API key — set_api_key
Set the Octopus API key — set_api_key
text: api_key API key. Octopus Energy customer, can generate API key developer dashboard.

title: Set the Octopus API key — set_api_key
text: return value, called side effects.

what: Set the details for your gas/electricity meter — set_meter_details
title: Set the details for your gas/electricity meter — set_meter_details
text: Set details gas/electricity meter. stored environment variables. add: OCTOPUSR_MPAN = <electric MPAN> (OCTOPUSR_MPAN_IMPORT/OCTOPUSR_MPAN_EXPORT) OCTOPUSR_MPRN = <gas MPRN> OCTOPUSR_ELEC_SERIAL_NUM = <electric serial number> (OCTOPUSR_ELEC_SERIAL_NUM_IMPORT/OCTOPUSR_ELEC_SERIAL_NUM_EXPORT) OCTOPUSR_GAS_SERIAL_NUM = <gas serial number> .Renviron otherwise call function every session. can find meter details (MPAN/MPRN serial number(s)) developer dashboard.

title: Set the details for your gas/electricity meter — set_meter_details
code: set_meter_details(   meter_type = c("electricity", "gas"),   mpan_mprn = NULL,   serial_number = NULL,   direction = NULL )

title: Set the details for your gas/electricity meter — set_meter_details
text: meter_type Type meter-point, electricity gas mpan_mprn electricity meter-point's MPAN gas meter-point’s MPRN. serial_number meter's serial number. direction electricity meters, specify "import", "export", NULL (default). NULL, uses legacy single MPAN storage. specified, stores separate import/export MPANs.

title: Set the details for your gas/electricity meter — set_meter_details
text: return value, called side effects.
